relations.target: invitation=04696397-n (a tempting allurement; \""she was an invitation to trouble\"");07200808-n (a request (spoken or written) to participate or be present or take part in something; \""an invitation to lunch\""; \""she threw the invitation away\""

platform=03028933-n (a woman's shoe with a very high thick sole);03968233-n (a raised horizontal surface; \""the speaker mounted the platform\"");03968819-n (any military structure or vehicle bearing weapons);03968979-n (the combination of a particular computer and a particular operating system);06513302-n (a document stating the aims and principles of a political party; \""their candidate simply ignored the party platform\""; \""they won the election even though they offered no positive program\""

stage=01651668-v (plan, organize, and carry out (an event); \""the neighboring tribe staged an invasion\"");01715304-v (perform (a play), especially on a stage; \""we are going to stage `Othello'\"");00307726-n (a section or portion of a journey or course; \""then we embarked on the second stage of our Caribbean cruise\"");04303700-n (a large platform on which people can stand and can be seen by an audience; \""he clambered up onto the stage and got the actors to help him into the box\"");04304087-n (a small platform on a microscope where the specimen is mounted for examination);04304236-n (a large coach-and-four formerly used to carry passengers and mail on regular routes between towns; \""we went out of town together by stage about ten or twelve miles\"");07019828-n (the theater as a profession (usually `the stage'); \""an early movie simply showed a long kiss by two actors of the contemporary stage\"");08664141-n (any scene regarded as a setting for exhibiting or doing something; \""All the world's a stage\""--Shakespeare; \""it set the stage for peaceful negotiations\"");13962925-n (a specific identifiable position in a continuum or series or especially in a process; \""a remarkable degree of frankness\""; \""at what stage are the social sciences?\"");15315573-n (any distinct time period in a sequence of events; \""we are in a transitional stage in which many former ideas must be revised or rejected\""
comedy=06794240-n (a comic incident or series of incidents);07028624-n (light and humorous drama with a happy ending)
poetry=07107220-n (literature in metrical form);07107939-n (any communication resembling poetry in beauty or the evocation of feeling)

music=00544270-n (musical activity (singing or whistling etc.); \""his music was his central interest\"");01165019-n (punishment for one's actions; \""you have to face the music\""; \""take your medicine\"");05726503-n (any agreeable (pleasing and harmonious) sounds; \""he fell asleep to the music of the wind chimes\"");05726882-n ((music) the sounds produced by singers or musical instruments (or reproductions of such sounds));07034009-n (an artistic form of auditory communication incorporating instrumental or vocal tones in a structured and continuous manner

senses.definition: A music, poetry, or comedy stage platform with open invitation, that is, where anyone is invited to perform
